english: (1) structural particle for verb complements; (2) to get, obtain; (3) must, have to

etymology.description: 貝(貝) (bèi, 'cowry') + 又(又) (yòu, 'hand') -> obtaining valuables -> 彳(彳) (chì, 'step') sometimes added -> 又(又) changes to 寸(寸) (cùn, 'inch') in Qin script -> 貝(貝) corrupts to resemble 見(見) (jiàn, 'see') in Shuowen (likely error) -> 貝(貝) simplified to resemble 旦(旦) (dàn, 'dawn') in clerical script -> final form得
etymology.interpretation: The character 得 depicts obtaining something valuable, starting with the ancient form showing a hand picking up a cowry. Over time, modifications and errors in historical scripts evolved the character into its current form.

examples.chinese: 我得到了礼物(我得到了禮物)，好开心(好開心)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ dé le yí gè lǐwù, hǎo kāixīn.
examples.english: I got a gift and I'm very happy.

examples.chinese: 我得早点出门(我得早點出門)，去赶火车(去趕火車)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ děi zǎodiǎn chūmén, qù gǎn huǒchē.
examples.english: I must leave early to catch the train.
